basics.name: Eric Sakmar
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Software engineer with a long career across the full stack. Excels at adapting to new technologies and techniques. Strives to create software that is readable and maintainable using a practical knowledge of software design patterns and principles.

work.name: Truefit
work.description: We’re a team of strategists, product owners, designers, architects, engineers, and testers collaborating to create new software products that deliver both business and user value.
work.summary: Hired as a senior software engineer and quickly became a trusted and productive team member through creating quality code, contributing to architecture decisions, and reviewing code.
highlights: Full stack development of a multi-platform application for creating and viewing educational content. Converted an existing application from proprietary technologies to a stack based on open source libraries and standards compliant technology.

work.name: Concurrent Technologies Corporation
work.location: Johnstown, PA; Alexandria, VA; Arlington, VA; Pittsburgh, PA
work.description: We support our clients’ core mission objectives with customized, full lifecycle solutions.
work.summary: Hired for a full-time position after a 2 year internship. Gathered a lot of experience and took on many new responsibilities through working on a broad range of projects in several different cities.
highlights: Full stack development in maintaining and updating a large enterprise application. Migrated the application from a tightly coupled monolith to a component based and service oriented architecture.
Mobile development, native and web, of a wide range of apps. These often had tight schedules and required a keen knowledge of the nuances and idioms of the various platforms and devices.
Back end development of services for digital learning content. This included federated search, content sharing and discovery, and managing course assets.

awards.title: Mobile Web Specialist
awards.summary: The Mobile Web Developer Certification is a performance-based exam that challenges mobile web developers to write code in response to real-world tasks.
